Purpose: To ensure accurate and consistent measurement, analysis, and documentation of Prostaglandin D2 (PG D2) levels in random urine samples.
Container: Clean, sterile urine container without preservatives
Equipment: High-performance liquid chromatography (HPLC) or enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) system, with supporting centrifuge, vortex mixer, and calibrated micropipettes
